001package imagingbook.lib.filter;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
005
006/**
007 * A generic scalar multi-pass filter with exactly 2 passes.
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2021/01/02
010 */
011public abstract class GenericFilterScalarSeparable extends GenericFilter {
012        
013        // for progress reporting only
014        private int slice;
015        private int sliceMax = 1;
016        
017        private int iter = 0;
018        private int iterMax = 1;        // for progress reporting only
019        
020        
021        // apply filter to a stack of pixel planes (1 pass)
022        @Override
023        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
024                sliceMax = source.getDepth();
025                for (int k = 0; k < sliceMax; k++) {
026                        //IJ.log("+++++++ starting slice " + k);
027                        this.slice = k;
028                        runSlice(source.getSlice(k), target.getSlice(k));       // default behavior: apply filter to each plane, place results in target
029                }
030        }
031        
032        // a bit wasteful, as we provide a separate target for each plane
033        private void runSlice(PixelSlice source, PixelSlice target) {
034                final int width = source.getWidth();
035                final int height = source.getHeight();
036                this.iterMax = width * height * 2;
037                this.iter = 0;
038                
039                // X-part
040                //IJ.log("doing X-part =============================== ");
041                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
042                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
043                                target.setVal(u, v, doPixelX(source, u, v));
044                                this.iter++;
045                        }
046                }
047                
048                target.copyTo(source);
049                
050                // Y-part
051                //IJ.log("doing Y-part =============================== ");
052                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
053                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
054                                target.setVal(u, v, doPixelY(source, u, v));
055                                this.iter++;
056                        }
057                }
058                
059                this.iter = 0;
060        }
061        
062        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
063
064        // Apply a 1D filter in x-direction
065        protected abstract float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
066
067        // Apply a 1D filter in y-direction
068        protected abstract float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
069        
070        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
071        
072        @Override
073        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
074                double loopProgress = (this.iter + subProgress) / this.iterMax;
075                //IJ.log("   loopProgress = " + loopProgress);
076                double sliceProgress = (this.slice + loopProgress) / this.sliceMax;
077                //IJ.log("   sliceProgress = " + sliceProgress);
078                //System.out.println("reportProgress: GenericFilterScalar " + localProgress);
079                return super.reportProgress(sliceProgress);
080        }
081
082        
083}
